title: Which party benefits from a December election?
text:
This year’s election will be on the first December polling day since 1923, and one of only a handful of winter elections in the last hundred years.

Incumbent governments have historically gone to the country on Thursdays in the Spring, believing that it gives them the best chance of re-election.

There is a wealth of popular wisdom that suggests turnout, demographics and voting intention could all be affected by an election’s date.

Weeks before Christmas, with less than eight hours of daylight and poor weather should be the worst time to call one.

But going to the country on a damp December day could actually be a boon for the Tories and see them returned to Government with a majority.
description: This year’s election will be on the first December polling day since 1923, and one of only a handful of winter elections in the last hundred years.
